intro: Struthanthus filipes, commonly known as the slender-flowered struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Struthanthus filipes is a short-lived perennial, often found in crevices and along canyon walls in its native habitat.
